text: Axtell Julius Byles (October 1, 1880 – September 28, 1941) was an American football player and coach. He served as the co-head football coach at Washington and Lee University in Lexington, Virginia with D. M. Balliet in 1903, compiling a record of 4–1. Byles died in 1941. ==Head coaching record== ==References== ==External links== * Category:1880 births Category:1941 deaths Category:Princeton Tigers football players Category:Washington and Lee Generals football coaches Category:People from Titusville, Pennsylvania Category:Players of American football from Pennsylvania
title: Axtell J. Byles
